data.headline: US stock futures fall as hawkish Fed minutes and Middle East tensions drive oil and gold higher, pressuring tech and retail stocks
bullets: S&P 500, Dow, Nasdaq 100, and Russell 2000 futures down 0.2–0.4% premarket amid risk-off sentiment
Fed minutes signal division and reduced rate-cut hopes, weighing on equities
US-Iran tensions push oil to six-month highs, boosting energy and gold sectors
Tech stocks retreat as AI enthusiasm fades following Nvidia's recent rally
Walmart drops over 3% on a disappointing outlook, dragging retail lower
Carvana tumbles after mixed results and higher costs
Jobless claims fall to a 2024 low of 206,000, highlighting labor market strength but failing to lift sentiment
Etsy surges nearly 20% on Depop sale to eBay; DoorDash, Deere, and Quanta Services also rally premarket
Wayfair and Stellantis among notable premarket losers
Traders closely watching oil volatility, Walmart’s open, and ongoing Fed commentary amid political scrutiny
